recipes.slug: Creamy, sweet and tangy all at once. Plus it is a super easy recipe to throw together.
recipes.title: BBQ Halloumi Chicken Pasta
steps: Season the chicken with a tsp bbq seasoning, tsp of smoked paprika, salt and pepper. Rub in throughly on both sides of the breasts before baking in the oven for 20 minutes on 180 degrees.
Pop the pasta on to boil in salted water.
In a seperate pan, fry off the red onion in a tsp garlic puree. Whilst this is softening, dice the halloumi and start to pan fry.

Add a tsp bbq seasoning, tsp of smoked paprika and the oregano to the pan with the onion in. Leave for a minute before adding the bbq sauce, chicken stock and cream cheese. Stir well add the pasta water and leave to simmer for 10 minutes on low-medium heat.
Slice the chicken once cooked. Remove 2 tbsp of the bbq sauce, combine the rest of the sauce with the pasta.
Plate up the pasta, top with the chicken, diced parsley and finish with the halloumi.

recipes.slug: A super tasty, portionable, lunch dish.
recipes.title: Chinese Style Sticky Pork Noodles
steps: Brown off the pork mince in a large wok
Whilst pork is cooking mix together all the ingredients for the sauce in a jug. (Soy Sauce, Honey, Ketjap Manis and Tomato Ketchup)
Once pork is browned off, add in the green beans and sauce at the same time and cover the wok, cook until green beans have softened

Whilst the green beans are softening up, if using dried noodles bring a large saucepan of water to boil and then add in your dried noodles until soft (Around 3-4 mins). Then rinse under cold water to prevent it sticking together. If using pre-cooked noodles, just wait for the green beans to soften.
Add your egg noodles to your wok and thoroughly mix together, giving it enough time to warm everything through.
Serve into bowls or into portion boxes to freeze.

recipes.title: Chicken and Pesto Pasta

ingredients.item: Large Ready Roasted Chicken Breasts, Shredded

steps: Cook pasta following pack instructions, adding green beans for the final 6 mins of cooking time. Drain and reserve a few tbsps of the cooking water.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large frying pan. Add spring onions and cook for 1-2 mins until soft, then set aside.

Add the shredded chicken in the pan and heat through. Stir through pesto and cream. Pop pasta and beans in with the chicken mix and stir to coat, adding a little of the cooking water. Season and sprinkle with Parmesan.

recipes.title: Easy Pancakes
steps: Put 100g plain flour, 2 large eggs, 300ml milk, 1 tbsp sunflower or vegetable oil and a pinch of salt into a bowl or large jug, then whisk to a smooth batter.
Set aside for 30 mins to rest if you have time, or start cooking straight away.
Set a medium frying pan or crÃªpe pan over a medium heat and carefully wipe it with some oiled kitchen paper.
When hot, cook your pancakes for 1 min on each side until golden, keeping them warm in a low oven as you go.
Serve with lemon wedges and caster sugar, or your favourite filling. Once cold, you can layer the pancakes between baking parchment, then wrap in cling film and freeze for up to 2 months.

recipes.title: Jambalaya

ingredients.item: Small Red Onion, Peeled and Chopped

steps: Heat a little oil in a heavy-bottomed Saucepan and fry the chorizo until crisp. Add the onion, garlic, celery and red pepper, and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes, until soft.
Stir in cayenne and cook for a further minute, then add the chicken, rice and stock. Bring to a boil, cover and simmer very gently for 30 minutes.
Keeping the lid on, remove from the heat and leave to stand for 5 minutes. Uncover and leave to cool Store in the fridge for up to 2 days
Eat cold or microwave on medium for 4-5 minutes, stirring halfway through.
recipes.notes: Source: Love Your Lunch Box - James Ramsden

recipes.title: Moist Chocolate Cake
steps: Pre-heat oven to 180C and prepare 2 8 inch tins.
Place all ingredients except boiling water into a bowl.
Beat together until smooth.
Add the boiling water a little at a time.
Beat well, this will be very liquid.
Pour into tins and bake for 25-35mins, 20mins for cupcakes
Once baked, leave to cool and then fill with your filling of choice (Nutella or Chocolate Fudge Icing are good choices)
